intro: Sacciolepis velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 16,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
